<a id="class_GLTFLight"></a>

# GLTFLight

**Inherits:** [Resource](class_resource.md) **<** [RefCounted](class_refcounted.md) **<** [Object](class_object.md)

Represents a glTF light.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Represents a light as defined by the ``KHR_lights_punctual`` glTF extension.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [Runtime file loading and saving](../tutorials/io/runtime_file_loading_and_saving.md)

- [KHR_lights_punctual glTF extension spec](https://github.com/KhronosGroup/glTF/blob/main/extensions/2.0/Khronos/KHR_lights_punctual)

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="class_GLTFLight_property_color"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Color](class_color.md) **color** = `Color(1, 1, 1, 1)` [ðŸ”—](#class_GLTFLight_property_color)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_color**\ (\ value\: [Color](class_color.md)\ )
- [Color](class_color.md) **get_color**\ (\ )

The [Color](class_color.md) of the light in linear space. Defaults to white. A black color causes the light to have no effect.

This value is linear to match glTF, but will be converted to nonlinear sRGB when creating a Redot [Light3D](class_light3d.md) node upon import, or converted to linear when exporting a Redot [Light3D](class_light3d.md) to glTF.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_GLTFLight_property_inner_cone_angle"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](class_float.md) **inner_cone_angle** = `0.0` [ðŸ”—](#class_GLTFLight_property_inner_cone_angle)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_inner_cone_angle**\ (\ value\: [float](class_float.md)\ )
- [float](class_float.md) **get_inner_cone_angle**\ (\ )

The inner angle of the cone in a spotlight. Must be less than or equal to the outer cone angle.

Within this angle, the light is at full brightness. Between the inner and outer cone angles, there is a transition from full brightness to zero brightness. When creating a Redot [SpotLight3D](class_spotlight3d.md), the ratio between the inner and outer cone angles is used to calculate the attenuation of the light.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_GLTFLight_property_intensity"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](class_float.md) **intensity** = `1.0` [ðŸ”—](#class_GLTFLight_property_intensity)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_intensity**\ (\ value\: [float](class_float.md)\ )
- [float](class_float.md) **get_intensity**\ (\ )

The intensity of the light. This is expressed in candelas (lumens per steradian) for point and spot lights, and lux (lumens per mÂ²) for directional lights. When creating a Redot light, this value is converted to a unitless multiplier.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_GLTFLight_property_light_type"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[String](class_string.md) **light_type** = `""` [ðŸ”—](#class_GLTFLight_property_light_type)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_light_type**\ (\ value\: [String](class_string.md)\ )
- [String](class_string.md) **get_light_type**\ (\ )

The type of the light. The values accepted by Redot are "point", "spot", and "directional", which correspond to Redot's [OmniLight3D](class_omnilight3d.md), [SpotLight3D](class_spotlight3d.md), and [DirectionalLight3D](class_directionallight3d.md) respectively.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_GLTFLight_property_outer_cone_angle"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](class_float.md) **outer_cone_angle** = `0.7853982` [ðŸ”—](#class_GLTFLight_property_outer_cone_angle)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_outer_cone_angle**\ (\ value\: [float](class_float.md)\ )
- [float](class_float.md) **get_outer_cone_angle**\ (\ )

The outer angle of the cone in a spotlight. Must be greater than or equal to the inner angle.

At this angle, the light drops off to zero brightness. Between the inner and outer cone angles, there is a transition from full brightness to zero brightness. If this angle is a half turn, then the spotlight emits in all directions. When creating a Redot [SpotLight3D](class_spotlight3d.md), the outer cone angle is used as the angle of the spotlight.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_GLTFLight_property_range"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](class_float.md) **range** = `inf` [ðŸ”—](#class_GLTFLight_property_range)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_range**\ (\ value\: [float](class_float.md)\ )
- [float](class_float.md) **get_range**\ (\ )

The range of the light, beyond which the light has no effect. glTF lights with no range defined behave like physical lights (which have infinite range). When creating a Redot light, the range is clamped to ``4096.0``.

<hr class="classref-section-separator">
